skills.name: Round integers to the nearest other power of 10
Round integers to the nearest other integer value (e.g. 20, 50 etc)

explanations.A: I think you have rounded to the nearest 100. We need to round to the nearest 10.
explanations.B: Not quite. 326 is between 320 and what other multiple of 10? Which is it closest to?
explanations.C: We need to round to the nearest 10. 326 is between 320 and 330. If we draw out a number line we will see that it is closer to 330 so that means it rounds to 330 to the nearest 10.
explanations.D: I think you have rounded to the nearest 50. We need to round to the nearest 10.

explanations.A: We need to round to the nearest 10. 637 is between 630 and 640. If we draw out a number line we will see that it is closer to 640 so that means it rounds to 640 to the nearest 10.
explanations.B: I think you have rounded to the nearest 50. We need to round to the nearest 10.
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 100. We need to round to the nearest 10.
explanations.D: Not quite. 637 is between 630 and what other multiple of 10? Which is it closest to?

explanations.A: 326 is between 300 and 400. If we draw out a number line we will see that it is closest to 300
explanations.B: 326 is between 300 and 400, but which is it closest to? You may find drawing a number line helpful.
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 10. Read the question carefully.
explanations.D: I think you have rounded to the nearest 50. Read the question carefully

explanations.A: 637 is between 600 and 700. If we draw out a number line we will see that it is closest to 600.
explanations.B: I think you have rounded to the nearest 50. Read the question carefully.
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 10. Read the question carefully.
explanations.D: 637 is between 600 and 700, but which is it closest to? You may find drawing a number line helpful

explanations.A: 1000 is the multiple of 1000 that is greater than 326. What multiple of 1000 is below 326?
explanations.B: This would be correct if our number was 3260, but it is 326. The multiples of 1000 are 0, 1000, 2000, 3000... Which one of these is 326 closest to?
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 500. Read the question carefully.
explanations.D: The multiples of 1000 that are above and below 326 are 1000 and 0. If we draw a numberline we will see that 326 is closest to 0.

explanations.A: I think you have rounded to the nearest 500. Read the question carefully.
explanations.B: The multiples of 1000 that are above and below 637 are 1000 and 0. If we draw a numberline we will see that 637 is closest to 1000.
explanations.C: 0 is the multiple of 1000 that is less than 637. What multiple of 1000 is above 637? Draw a number line to see which it is closest to.
explanations.D: This would be correct if our number was 6370, but it is 637. The multiples of 1000 are 0, 1000, 2000, 3000... Which one of these is 637 closest to?

explanations.A: I think you have rounded to the nearest 100,000. Read the question carefully.
explanations.B: We need to look at the 10,000 column. That is the first 3 in 536,463. Therefore the multiple of 10,000 below our number is 530,000 and the multiple of 10,000 above our number is 540,000. If you draw a numberline you will see that 536,463 is closest to 540,000. You could also tell this without the use of a number line as the digit after the number we're rounding to (after the 10,000 column) is greater than or equal to a 5 so it will round up.
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 1,000. Read the question carefully.
explanations.D: 536,463 is between 530,000 and 540,000, but which is it closest to? You may find drawing a number line helpful.

explanations.A: I think you have rounded to the nearest 1,000. Read the question carefully.
explanations.B: 287,045 is between 280,000 and 290,000, but which is it closest to? You may find drawing a number line helpful.
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 100,000. Read the question carefully.
explanations.D: We need to look at the 10,000 column. That is the 8 in 287,045. Therefore the multiple of 10,000 below our number is 280,000 and the multiple of 10,000 above our number is 290,000. If you draw a numberline you will see that 287,045 is closest to 290,000. You could also tell this without the use of a number line as the digit after the number we're rounding to (after the 10,000 column) is greater than or equal to a 5 so it will round up.

explanations.A: I think you have rounded to the nearest 50. Read the question carefully.
explanations.B: 620 is a multiple of 20, but it is not the closest multiple of 20 to 646. Count on in 20s and maybe draw a numberline to help you.
explanations.C: If we think of our multiples of 20 we know that 600 will be a multiple of 20 as 100 is and it is just 6 times greater. Therefore we can count on in 20s and get 600, 620, 640, 660. We can then see that 646 is closest to 640.
explanations.D: I think you have rounded to the nearest 100. Read the question carefully.

explanations.A: If we think of our multiples of 50 we get 50, 100, 150, 200 and so on. Continuing this pattern we know that 600 and 650 are multiples of 50. Drawing a number line we can see that 623 is closest to 600.
explanations.B: Not quite. Start by working out which multiples of 50 this number is near to. Then draw a numberline to find the one it is closest to.
explanations.C: I think you have rounded to the nearest 10 or the nearest 20. Read the question carefully.
explanations.D: 623 is between 600 and 650, but which is it closest to? You may find drawing a number line helpful.
